dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ah, the good captain. My Iconoclasts sing your praises. I'm glad the Eternal Truth has finally guided you to us.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This is Amber Heights? I expected more... altars. Or incense. Or both.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your people do seem to need a lot of help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Happy to help. The colony needs more people watching out for one another.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Shed the trappings of a materialistic life, Captain. You'll find your soul much less burdened.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Also, we're broke.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes. If we were meant to enjoy the things that glitter and shine, the universe would provide them.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Makes sense. You need to survive. You can't afford frivolity.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's a refreshing perspective. Most of Halcyon obsesses over what they can buy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It has provided them. On store shelves.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Damn right we can't. We're being eaten alive out here. We can't be throwing bits at-

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Zora, please. We'll discuss this later.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: I apologize. My second-in-command can be overzealous at times.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now. Why have you come?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm just looking for ways to help the people here. Anything need doing?

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: A great many things, in fact.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: We could always use a hand rounding up supplies.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Or... now, here's an idea. There's an old printing press I've been trying to get up and running.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A... printing press? On Monarch?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: ...why?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wouldn't supplies help more?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm guessing you need it cleared out.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, yes. Many facilities lie abandoned in the wilderness. I believe the press could be operational again with a little elbow grease and luck.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Will you aid us in our cause?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sure.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't think so.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wonderful. I requisitioned replacement rollers for it some time ago - Huxley should have delivered them yesterday.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Speaking of which... where is Huxley?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You bought... rollers? You haven't even cleared the rapts out yet! What are you doing wasting bits on...

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ugh. Forget it. Huxley's still recovering. She won't be up for a run for a while yet.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: It seems we're out a runner. If you intend to help our cause, I'll ask you to meet our MSI supplier in her stead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: MSI supplies you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Where is the supplier?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All right. I'll be back.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: One of our sympathizers, a woman named Carlotta, periodically buys goods on our behalf from Stellar Bay's store.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Stellar Bay has caught on, but they remain friendly - though the goods now come at a considerable markup.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: She meets us in the ruins of Bayside Terrace. From our compound, follow the road north.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wonderful. While you're at it... I wonder if Carlotta still has those high-capacity cartridges. Grab a few, will you? There should be some funds leftover from the last shipment.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: We can use them to copy and modify radio serials. Yes! Not just magazines, but their precious dramas!

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Unbelievable.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I hope I don't have to tell you this, but if there IS extra money, would you mind buying... I don't know, food and medicine?

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: So be it. If you find helping us to be on your path, we will be here.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: I have always dreamed of subverting the colony's periodicals and turning the Board's own propaganda against them.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: If I could get my message directly in the hands of Byzantium citizens, I'm sure they'd recognize the truth.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yes.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: We will make do - as we always have. Spreading the word of our movement is of paramount importance.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Indeed, but first we need the parts I ordered.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Most of Halcyon isn't up sulfur creek.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'd wager the opposite. The corporations are doomed. Only we have the truth at our backs and we are better for it.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: No, no, no. There's a difference. Come back for a meditation session later. The peace will clear your mind.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I shudder to think how wasteful we used to be before we were abandoned.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Indeed - the corporate life is nothing but wanton excess and waste. The Truth has shown us how careful we must be.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: The harshness of life tests our mettle. It is proof that we are worthy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Survival of the fittest and all that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I suppose you are still here, after all. How are you surviving?

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Indeed. Every day we struggle against the odds, and it is only through the strength of our beliefs that we persist.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: That and a healthy amount of ammunition.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes. Monarch demands so much violence. It's such a shame that so many people aren't willing to listen until their lives are on the line.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: We shoot things. Then we eat the things we shoot. And we thank the Eternal the rapts haven't evolved opposable thumbs.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: That is the way of it, yes! The universe wouldn't have produced the magnificence that is mankind if it were in constant competition with itself.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: We are all part of the same cosmic body. Must one hand cut off the other?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well. Sometimes. There's disease and rot and... ah, you know what, forget it. Your metaphors are wise beyond me.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Point is, around these parts, we watch out for one another.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Indeed! Welcome to our home.
